title: Ticket #7151: Improve usability of StartCommandRequest
description:
SecMan::StartCommandRequest is a structure used to condense ten parameters of Daemon::startCommand_internal into one. Presently, each member of the structure is initialized explicitly, on its own line. There should be a way to improve both the usability of the interface and the readability of code using it.

The first step may be to eliminate redundant assignments (the structure already has initializers for all of its members).

The second step may to be add a constructor for only those variables which everybody always needs to set (e.g., which are initialized to nullptr but which aren't optional). This may not actually help with the problem.

One further possibility is to analyze patterns in the usage and write a few well-name factory functions (but not constructors, because we can't change the names of those).

Another (suggest by GregT), is to arrange the interface as function calls describing what you want to do. For instance: 

StartCommandRequest scr( UPDATE_STARTD_AD, sock ); // maybe?
scr.registerCallback( callback_fn, callback_data );
scr.reportErrors( errStack );

although this may require making extensive changes further up the call-chain (where the semantic information originates).
